lead_paragraph: A spokeswoman for the mayor said that starting in October, the city would retest every building that had at least one water sample that exceeded 15 parts per billion of lead.

headline.print_headline: City Pledges  to Change  Lead Testing  in Its Schools
headline.main: New York City Will Change Lead Testing Methods at Its Schools

snippet: A spokeswoman for the mayor said that starting in October, the city would retest every building that had at least one water sample that exceeded 15 parts per billion of lead....
abstract: New York City officials say they will change their procedures for testing lead in school water supplies after experts criticized method of pre-stagnation flushing, which involves running water from all outlets for two hours; critics say flushing cleans pipes of soluble lead and lead particles, and results in samples with low lead levels.
